title: American_Top_40_1987_May_30th
description:
"The hottest hits, the hottest stars!"


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

The first country cross-over hit in three-and-a-half years is at number 40, "I'll Still Be Loving You" by Restless Heart.

From the AT40 book of records, Casey tells about the oldest man to ever hit number one. Born in New Orleans on the 4th of July, this 63 year-old man pushed the Beatles out of their 14 week number one monopoly back in 1964.

There is a song by the man who voters chose as having the sexiest eyes in the world. He beat out Tom Cruise, Frank Sinatra, and Paul Newman.

Jody Whatley is at number 12 with "Looking For A New Love." Casey tells how she got her break when a group that didn't exist suddenly had to.   

Casey answers the most asked question AT40 ever got, "Have any records ever dropped from the number one spot, then come back and hit number one again?" There were 33 such hits, but Casey plays parts of the only two songs to hit number one THREE times.

40:    I'll Still Be Loving You - Restless Heart    
39:    The Finer Things - Steve Winwood
38:    Endless Nights - Eddie Money
37:    Sweet Sixteen - Billy Idol    
36:    Every Little Kiss - Bruce Hornsby & The Range
